text: the iOS code is currently only for iPhone

if we wanted to add iPad we could either
1. shim the current code with an iPad version (this is a lot of work and a huge headache for weeks at a time),
2. create an entirely separate project with the iPad app (this is a lot of work and pretty silly, from a maintenance point of view), or
3. rewrite the current project to have both iPhone and iPad targets (this is a similar amount of work to the other options and also gives us a huge advantage for future maintenance--maybe after a rewrite the code won't have so many gaping wounds)
<!channel>: are we saying that we dont want to support eprint since it requires server side/node work?
I'm saying I'm not equipped to do the server work for ePrint to support photogram
i could learn Node, and <@U026PHQ3J> seems to think that's not difficult, but I think I've already got my hands full with the iOS code
it sounds like then part of month 4's hours need to go toward photogram as well.
i'll figure out the accounting tonight & get back to you with the plan tomorrow, and pending shane's design direction, we can move forward. how does this sound?
